definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - SSD?
threads.message:
So I had an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> you helped me work on a while back that was suffering from the flashing folder missing ssd problem, 

I now have 2 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> macs here that have been repaired and are working fine except for the SSD drives, I have 2 original apple SSD drives 
[ATTACH]60637[/ATTACH]
One is a 2016 and the other is a 2017 ssd, and they are both behaving the same, as in if I have the charge cable connected to the macbook it will boot install os and work perfectly, if I remove the charger again they work perfectly until the battery goes below 30%. If I leave the mac on it will work until the battery runs out but if you try to restart the mac you get a flashing folder icon and the drive can't be seen at all until you charge the battery above 30%. As soon as the mac is above the 30% battery level or charger is reconnected it works perfectly, 

This behaviour is the same with these ssd drives in 2 different macbooks so it's deffinatly the ssd at fault, question is have you seen anything like this before? Are these drives salvageable or do I bin them and find replacements? 

Also thorght this info was useful to anyone trying to diagnose an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> whe flashing folder problem,

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - SSD?
threads.message:
This kind of SSD module has an internal SMPS (switched mode power supply), connected to <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
When battery drops under 30%, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is also low and mentioned SMPS stops to work correctly.
It shouldn't happen, seems Apple didn't properly test their devices.
